title: Can DNA Evidence Be Too Convincing? An Acquitted Man Thinks So
description: A man arrested and charged with robbery, partly because of DNA evidence, spent a year and a half on Rikers Island before being cleared.
dc:creator: Eli Rosenberg
media:credit: Heather Ainsworth for The New York Times
media:description: “I was a period without a sentence,” Terrell Gills, accused of robbing a Queens doughnut store, said of his time at Rikers Island.
